intro: Onosma kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi's sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are usually arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Onosma kotschyi is often found in steppic and semi-desert habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
